3.text: The One Tree Project is located approximately 130 km northeast of Kalgoorlie (Figure 1). The

4.text: Project  area  lies  between  Lake  Rebecca  to  the  south  and  Lake  Raeside  to  the  north  and  is

5.text: located  15  km  to  the  north  of  the  Porphyry  Gold  Mine.  The  tenement  is  located  on  the

6.text: Edjudina  1:250  000  Sheet  (H  51-06)  and  is  situated  in  the  Yerilla  District  of  the  North

7.text: Coolgardie  Mineral  Field.  Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  –

8.text: Mount Celia Road or the Kalgoorlie -  Pinjin – Edjudina road.

10.text: The  tenement  lies  within  the  Mulgabbie  domain  of  the  Kurnalpi  terrane.  In  this  terrane,

11.text: greenstone  units  form  a  west-dipping  homoclinal  sequence  that  has  been  dissected  by  late,

12.text: north-trending faults. The Mulgabbie domain comprises metamorphosed mafic volcanics and

13.text: intrusives,  predominantly  amphibolite  and  metabasalt,  minor  ultramafics  and  biotite

14.text: monzogranite plutons (Figure 3.). Granitoids emplaced prior to regional folding are interpreted

15.text: to have intruded the Yarri Domain greenstones as sheets conformable with overall greenstone

16.text: layering. Tenement P31/1618 overlies one of these granitoid sheets.

18.text: Tenement P31/1618 was part of a package of tenements purchased by Jackson Gold Resources

19.text: from Le Chem Pty Ltd in April 2004 for a cash consideration of $5000.00 and an issue of

20.text: 25000 fully paid Jackson shares. Jackson agreed to pay Le Chem $5 per troy ounce royalty for

21.text: any gold produced from the tenements.

23.text: Exploration  activities  included  a  detailed  project  review,  data  compilation,  soil  auger

24.text: sampling, as well as processing of regional aeromagnetic, landsat and gravity data (Figure 2).

text:
The One Tree Project is located approximately 130 km northeast of Kalgoorlie (Figure 1). The 
 Project  area  lies  between  Lake  Rebecca  to  the  south  and  Lake  Raeside  to  the  north  and  is 
 located  15  km  to  the  north  of  the  Porphyry  Gold  Mine.  The  tenement  is  located  on  the 
 Edjudina  1:250  000  Sheet  (H  51-06)  and  is  situated  in  the  Yerilla  District  of  the  North 
 Coolgardie  Mineral  Field.  Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  – 
 Mount Celia Road or the Kalgoorlie -  Pinjin – Edjudina road. 
 The  tenement  lies  within  the  Mulgabbie  domain  of  the  Kurnalpi  terrane.  In  this  terrane, 
 greenstone  units  form  a  west-dipping  homoclinal  sequence  that  has  been  dissected  by  late, 
 north-trending faults. The Mulgabbie domain comprises metamorphosed mafic volcanics and 
 intrusives,  predominantly  amphibolite  and  metabasalt,  minor  ultramafics  and  biotite 
 monzogranite plutons (Figure 3.). Granitoids emplaced prior to regional folding are interpreted 
 to have intruded the Yarri Domain greenstones as sheets conformable with overall greenstone 
 layering. Tenement P31/1618 overlies one of these granitoid sheets. 
 Tenement P31/1618 was part of a package of tenements purchased by Jackson Gold Resources 
 from Le Chem Pty Ltd in April 2004 for a cash consideration of $5000.00 and an issue of  
 25000 fully paid Jackson shares. Jackson agreed to pay Le Chem $5 per troy ounce royalty for 
 any gold produced from the tenements. 
 Exploration  activities  included  a  detailed  project  review,  data  compilation,  soil  auger 
 sampling, as well as processing of regional aeromagnetic, landsat and gravity data (Figure 2).

13.text: Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  –  Mount  Celia  Road  or  the

14.text: Kalgoorlie -  Pinjin – Edjudina road. Topography is subdued and the maximum relief is less

15.text: than 150m. The physiography is to a large extent related to the underlying geology. Northwest

16.text: –striking ridges are underlain by mafic rocks and banded iron-formations. Areas underlain by

17.text: greenstones and granitoids are gently undulating with plateaus of laterite and highly weathered

18.text: bedrock.  Lake  Rebecca  and  Lake  Raeside  form  two  prominent  salt-lake  drainage  systems,

19.text: stretching from northwest to southeast. The lakes are flanked by dunes separating small lakes

23.text: as well as processing of regional aeromagnetic, landsat and gravity data (Figure 2).

text:
Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  –  Mount  Celia  Road  or  the  
 Kalgoorlie -  Pinjin – Edjudina road. Topography is subdued and the maximum relief is less 
 than 150m. The physiography is to a large extent related to the underlying geology. Northwest 
 –striking ridges are underlain by mafic rocks and banded iron-formations. Areas underlain by 
 greenstones and granitoids are gently undulating with plateaus of laterite and highly weathered 
 bedrock.  Lake  Rebecca  and  Lake  Raeside  form  two  prominent  salt-lake  drainage  systems, 
 stretching from northwest to southeast. The lakes are flanked by dunes separating small lakes 
 Exploration activities included a detailed project review, data compilation, auger soil sampling 
 as well as processing of regional aeromagnetic, landsat and gravity data (Figure 2).

text:
The One Tree Project area lies within the eastern part of the Eastern Goldfields Province of 
 the  Yilgarn  Craton  (Swager,  1995).  The  project  occurs  along  the  eastern  boundary  of  the

21.text: Both  the  Barba  Hills  and  Yarri  Domains  contain  several  basaltic  and  felsic  volcaniclastic

22.text: sequences with thin and/ or discontinuous ultramafic (komatiite) layers. Within both domains,

23.text: low angle regional shear zones bound or truncate lithologic- stratigraphic packages. The Barba

24.text: Hills  Domain  lies  on  the  eastern  limb  of  a  regional  anticline,  the  core  of  which  is  largely

25.text: represented  by  an  extensive  granitoid  complex.  The  Yarri  Domain  appears  to  form  a  west-

28.text: Granitoids  emplaced  prior  to  regional  folding  are  interpreted  to  have  intruded  the  Yarri

29.text: Domain  greenstones  as  sheets  conformable  with  overall  greenstone  layering.  Tenement

30.text: P31/1618 overlies one of these granitoid sheets.  Post-regional folding granitoids tend to be

31.text: ovoid to slightly ellipsoidal in outcrop pattern, they include the Porphyry Quartz Monzonite.

36.text: Granodiorites and monzogranites outcrop extensively throughout tenement P31/1618. Quartz

37.text: veining is common throughout the granitoids (Brigden, 1997).

text:
Both  the  Barba  Hills  and  Yarri  Domains  contain  several  basaltic  and  felsic  volcaniclastic 
 sequences with thin and/ or discontinuous ultramafic (komatiite) layers. Within both domains, 
 low angle regional shear zones bound or truncate lithologic- stratigraphic packages. The Barba 
 Hills  Domain  lies  on  the  eastern  limb  of  a  regional  anticline,  the  core  of  which  is  largely 
 represented  by  an  extensive  granitoid  complex.  The  Yarri  Domain  appears  to  form  a  west-
 Granitoids  emplaced  prior  to  regional  folding  are  interpreted  to  have  intruded  the  Yarri 
 Domain  greenstones  as  sheets  conformable  with  overall  greenstone  layering.  Tenement 
 P31/1618 overlies one of these granitoid sheets.  Post-regional folding granitoids tend to be 
 ovoid to slightly ellipsoidal in outcrop pattern, they include the Porphyry Quartz Monzonite. 
 Granodiorites and monzogranites outcrop extensively throughout tenement P31/1618. Quartz 
 veining is common throughout the granitoids (Brigden, 1997).

2.text: Gold mineralisation is present in several linear zones of alteration in a variety of host rocks.

3.text: The  Porphyry  mine  was  the  only  major  producer  (about  4.5  Mt)  in  the  area.  The  Yarri

4.text: Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central and Yarri

5.text: Proprietary  mines.  Smaller  amounts  of  gold  have  come  from  mafic-hosted  deposits  in  the

6.text: country  rocks.  The  main  contributor  was  the  amphibolite-hosted  Yarri  South  mine  which

9.text: The main line of workings within the Yarri Monzogranite, almost 1500 m long, encompasses

text:
Gold mineralisation is present in several linear zones of alteration in a variety of host rocks. 
 The  Porphyry  mine  was  the  only  major  producer  (about  4.5  Mt)  in  the  area.  The  Yarri 
 Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central and Yarri 
 Proprietary  mines.  Smaller  amounts  of  gold  have  come  from  mafic-hosted  deposits  in  the 
 country  rocks.  The  main  contributor  was  the  amphibolite-hosted  Yarri  South  mine  which 
 produced 40 kg of gold (GSWA Report 90).  
 The main line of workings within the Yarri Monzogranite, almost 1500 m long, encompasses

10.text: the  more  or  less  contiguous  workings  at  Wallaby  North,  Wallaby  Central,  and  Yarri

11.text: Proprietary. The workings have exposed a 330 – 340o –trending, subvertical to steeply west

12.text: dipping  shear  zone  that  is  more  or  less  conformable  within  the  regional  foliation.  The

13.text: mineralized shears are commonly located at the margins of prominent quartz veins of similar

14.text: orientation. They represent zones of relatively high strain that may have been localized by the

15.text: contrast in competency between the veins and the wall rocks. Farther south, the mafic-hosted

16.text: workings at Star of Yarri (Beatrice) and Queens Birthday, appear to lie on a different trend to

17.text: that defined by the monzogranite-hosted deposits. The structure at Yarri South is a steeply east

18.text: dipping, banded brittle-ductile shear zone (GSWA Report 90).

20.text: The Porphyry and Million Dollar deposits occur within two 20o - 25o east-dipping shear zones

21.text: within  the  Porphyry  Quartz  Monzonite.  The  Porphyry  shear  zone,  which  cuts  the  eastern

22.text: margin  of  the  intrusion,  is  approximately  25m  wide.  Gold  is  localized  in  a  series  of  en

23.text: echeolon lenses, with the highest grades contained within mylonitic zones about 10cm thick

24.text: (Swager, 1995). The alteration mineralogy is quartz-muscovite-pyrite, and probably includes

25.text: fine-grained hematite produced at a late stage of mineralisation. The low-grade Million Dollar

26.text: mineralized shear occurs some 350 m above the Porphyry shear and two kilometres south of

32.text: The surface cover on tenement P31/1618 consists of red sandy soils which are Aeolian in part,

33.text: and granite derived sandy soils forming the remainder. The regolith in the area is shown in the

39.text: It is evident from the regional aeromagnetic data that the majority of the structures trend in a

40.text: northwest  direction,  parallel  to  stratigraphy  (Figure  5.)  The  low  angle  regional  shear  zones

41.text: bound or truncate lithologic – stratigraphic packages.

43.text: The post-regional folding granitoids  are  clearly evident in  the  aeromagnetic data from their

44.text: ellipsoidal signature. Granitoids, including the one underlying tenement P31/1618, emplaced

45.text: prior to regional folding occur as magnetically quiet areas, which are generally conformable

text:
the  more  or  less  contiguous  workings  at  Wallaby  North,  Wallaby  Central,  and  Yarri 
 Proprietary. The workings have exposed a 330 – 340o –trending, subvertical to steeply west 
 dipping  shear  zone  that  is  more  or  less  conformable  within  the  regional  foliation.  The 
 mineralized shears are commonly located at the margins of prominent quartz veins of similar 
 orientation. They represent zones of relatively high strain that may have been localized by the 
 contrast in competency between the veins and the wall rocks. Farther south, the mafic-hosted 
 workings at Star of Yarri (Beatrice) and Queens Birthday, appear to lie on a different trend to 
 that defined by the monzogranite-hosted deposits. The structure at Yarri South is a steeply east 
 dipping, banded brittle-ductile shear zone (GSWA Report 90).  
 The Porphyry and Million Dollar deposits occur within two 20o - 25o east-dipping shear zones 
 within  the  Porphyry  Quartz  Monzonite.  The  Porphyry  shear  zone,  which  cuts  the  eastern 
 margin  of  the  intrusion,  is  approximately  25m  wide.  Gold  is  localized  in  a  series  of  en 
 echeolon lenses, with the highest grades contained within mylonitic zones about 10cm thick 
 (Swager, 1995). The alteration mineralogy is quartz-muscovite-pyrite, and probably includes 
 fine-grained hematite produced at a late stage of mineralisation. The low-grade Million Dollar 
 mineralized shear occurs some 350 m above the Porphyry shear and two kilometres south of 
 The surface cover on tenement P31/1618 consists of red sandy soils which are Aeolian in part, 
 and granite derived sandy soils forming the remainder. The regolith in the area is shown in the 
 Landsat TM Image (Figure 4).   
 It is evident from the regional aeromagnetic data that the majority of the structures trend in a 
 northwest  direction,  parallel  to  stratigraphy  (Figure  5.)  The  low  angle  regional  shear  zones 
 bound or truncate lithologic – stratigraphic packages.  
 The post-regional folding granitoids  are  clearly evident in  the  aeromagnetic data from their 
 ellipsoidal signature. Granitoids, including the one underlying tenement P31/1618, emplaced 
 prior to regional folding occur as magnetically quiet areas, which are generally conformable 
 with overall greenstone layering.

16.text: significant gold reserves at the Porphyry deposit.

 significant gold reserves at the Porphyry deposit.  
   
 Edjudina gold exploration

25.text: Southern Ventures NL conducted exploration over tenement P31/1618 during the period 1985

26.text: to 1989. Colour aerial photography and aeromagnetics were flown over the area however no

27.text: targets were defined. No other exploration undertaken fell over tenement P31/1618.  Southern

28.text: Ventures NL concluded that although the area had not been tested in detail, sufficient work

29.text: had been undertaken to discount any major economic gold occurrence.

42.text: Mining  Pty  was  not  conducted  in  the  area  now  covered  by  tenement  P31/1618.  It  was

43.text: concluded  that  the  weak  gold  anomalism  delineated  from  geochemical  exploration  did  not

text:
Southern Ventures NL conducted exploration over tenement P31/1618 during the period 1985 
 to 1989. Colour aerial photography and aeromagnetics were flown over the area however no 
 targets were defined. No other exploration undertaken fell over tenement P31/1618.  Southern 
 Ventures NL concluded that although the area had not been tested in detail, sufficient work 
 had been undertaken to discount any major economic gold occurrence.

 Companies  Pancontinental Mining Pty

 target shear-hosted gold mineralisation associated with splays off the Keith Kilkenny Tectonic

 Mining  Pty  was  not  conducted  in  the  area  now  covered  by  tenement  P31/1618.  It  was 
 concluded  that  the  weak  gold  anomalism  delineated  from  geochemical  exploration  did  not 
 The Yarri Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central 
 and Yarri Proprietary mines. Smaller amounts of gold have come from mafic-hosted deposits, 
 the main contributor was the amphibolite-hosted Yarri South mine which produced 40 kg of 
 Significant  quantities  of  gold  have  been  extracted  from  deposits  hosted  by  the  Porphyry

9.text: The Edjudina Region was first examined by prospectors at the beginning of the last centaury

10.text: and several gold deposits were located and worked at that time. Modern exploration began in

11.text: the  early  1970’s  when  the  areas  underlain  by  ultramafic  rocks  were  examined  for  nickel

text:
The Edjudina Region was first examined by prospectors at the beginning of the last centaury 
 and several gold deposits were located and worked at that time. Modern exploration began in 
 the  early  1970’s  when  the  areas  underlain  by  ultramafic  rocks  were  examined  for  nickel

18.text: All  available  airborne  geophysical  datasets  were  acquired  and  processed  (Figure  5.).    This

19.text: included  the  Geoscience  Australia  Magnetic  Map  of  Australia  and  associated  400m  line

20.text: spaced grids, multi-client 200m line spaced data, and proprietary open and closed file data.

21.text: Coordinate  transformations  into  the  MGA  grid  system  was  preformed.  Grids  were  levelled,

22.text: Fourier  domain  derivative  processed,  and  filtered  to  enhance  the  structural  and  lithological

23.text: texture.    All  grids  were  processed  to  produce  and  compile  mosaic  GIS  images  in  MGA

text:
All  available  airborne  geophysical  datasets  were  acquired  and  processed  (Figure  5.).    This 
 included  the  Geoscience  Australia  Magnetic  Map  of  Australia  and  associated  400m  line 
 spaced grids, multi-client 200m line spaced data, and proprietary open and closed file data. 
 Coordinate  transformations  into  the  MGA  grid  system  was  preformed.  Grids  were  levelled, 
 Fourier  domain  derivative  processed,  and  filtered  to  enhance  the  structural  and  lithological 
 texture.    All  grids  were  processed  to  produce  and  compile  mosaic  GIS  images  in  MGA

•  Bouguer Gravity data (BG) 
 •  Digital Terrain Model data (DTM) 
 The derivative processing including:

36.text: •  Automatic Gain Control filter with 21x21 window and 0.7 gain (agc2107)

38.text: •  Upward continued Bouguer Gravity (to produce residual gravity grid)

40.text: Radiometric and Landsat data were processed to produce the individual multi-band datasets

41.text: required  for  band  ratios.    Standard  and  enhanced  ratios  were  completed.    Digital  Terrain

42.text: Model data was integrated with the remote sensing data to provide regolith models.

44.text: This  geophysical  imagery  was  integrated  with  all  available  GIS,  geological  and  surface

45.text: geochemical data to enhance the interpretation process.

text:
•  First Vertical Derivative (z10) 
 •  Automatic Gain Control filter with 21x21 window and 0.7 gain (agc2107) 
 •  Second Vertical Derivative (z20) 
 •  Upward continued Bouguer Gravity (to produce residual gravity grid) 
 Radiometric and Landsat data were processed to produce the individual multi-band datasets 
 required  for  band  ratios.    Standard  and  enhanced  ratios  were  completed.    Digital  Terrain 
 Model data was integrated with the remote sensing data to provide regolith models.   
 This  geophysical  imagery  was  integrated  with  all  available  GIS,  geological  and  surface 
 geochemical data to enhance the interpretation process.

19.text: During the 2004 - 2005 reporting period Jackson Gold continued to monitor and regulate the

text:
A peak value of 0.01 ppm Au was returned from the auger drilling programme.  
 During the 2004 - 2005 reporting period Jackson Gold continued to monitor and regulate the 
 environmental impact of its exploration activities.  This was achieved through the continual 
 use  of  our  internal  compliance  audit  program.    All  activities  were  undertaken  with  those 
 guidelines  set  by  the  Department  of  Industry  and  Resources  as  a  minimum.    Through  its 
 Environmental  Policy,  Jackson  Gold  is  committed  to  managing  its  activities  in  an 
 environmentally responsible manner and actively pursues environmental excellence.

3.text: the  reporting  period.  The  auger  drilling  was  conducted  along  a  single  east-west  traverse.
